text:
I created a custom module for this type of content.
It contains repeatable columns which are initialized by default to two as the example above.

However, when I insert it in a page, it displays these two columns but the options on the left are empty.
And when I click to add a column, it overwrites my default values.

Have you encountered this problem before?

<@U25C65C3S> yep. I always used to do this by setting the value chosen in Module A in a `<span id="something" style="display:none">{{ module.something }}</span>` then you can read that from another module via JS and do something with it. It’s a bit brittle, but it can be helpful in certain scenarios. There may be a better way!

This is a bit of documentation questions/suggestion: in Local Devin' adding the appropriate fields in the `fields.json` is super easy with the vs code plugin, but I always forget the intricacies of the "snippet" template tag to add the to html.  most are pretty easy (`{{ module.text_thing}}`) but some have some more details I am not always clear on pulling these in. For eg line breaks for a text field
I see <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/module-theme-fields#field-types> but these only include the json bits, not the html bits

and lastly, as tip to the fabulous documentation team, it would be nice to have some kind of right or left nav for each field type so its not scroll city, kind of like there is for the tags documentation <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/tags>
<@U7SL518D6> adding you here because I know you love documentation feedback :wink:
<@U7SL518D6> thanks for that clarity on the repeating and grouping btw in the documentation. Saw that and it is super helpful

Thank you for the feedback Douglas. We agree, this actually is something we plan to get added. Along with some other adjustments to that page.

You can expect that we will be continuously iterating on this page to make it more and more useful over time.
:thumbsup: thanks man! for now whenever I don't know the right templating bit, I just go over to the DM and "copy snippet"
for example I always forget the syntax for CTA's. `{{ cta guid="blah" }}` or whatever it is

We hear ya on the side navigation.  Right now we’re autogenerating it from the headings.

A few changes will be coming to this page, not sure which will happen first, but this will get better.
Thanks <@U7SL518D6> They sure are getting better and better everyday!
There is a best practice on having content globally managed for a module that is still drag and droppable?
